Faults.message:
We're aware of the power cut affecting this local area. As many will know, yesterday's weather caused significant damage to our network, and this resulted in a large number of power cuts. Throughout yesterday and into last night, our teams were working as hard as they could to get as many properties restored as possible.

Our engineers are back out today prioritising faults based on time off and largest customer numbers. We're aiming to have the power restored to all homes this afternoon and there is a estimated restoration time you can see for your power cut on this page.

As part of our support package, if you've been without power for 12 hours, you're entitled to claim £30 per person for food and drink for every day you're without power. Just keep proof of purchase and submit the claim after your power is back on at www.ssen.co.uk/stormclaim.

We will continue to update this page with any new information and you can register for text updates here too.

If you need any further support, please contact us on 105 or send us a message on Facebook
Faults.name: BA14 Area

Faults.name: BA22 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Due to a busier than usual day, all of our engineers are currently working on other faults. We have made the local teams aware of your power cut and they are working hard to find resources to attend and get your power back on. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 14:00 26/11/2024.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'PW0157'

Faults.name: OX2 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 21 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting a large area, and it's likely several streets in your area are affected by the same power cut.

We have engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at 19:45 25/11/2024. Once they arrive, they will get straight to work on investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continue to update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming to have your power restored by 04:00 26/11/2024.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'PW1279'
Faults.name: BH24 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by . If this changes, we will update this message.

The cause of this issue is low voltage on the network powering your home. There are various reasons for why this could happen, and our engineers will get to the bottom of the cause, however, in many cases, it is because there is either a fault on our network which is not allowing enough electricity to travel through the cables, or there is too much electricity being used in the local area. Either way, the team working on this fault will get it sorted and will have your power back to normal as soon as possible. In the meantime, you should try to avoid using any non-essential appliances (such as washing machines and tumble dryers) this should mean your other appliances are able to work more effectively.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'PW1275'

Faults.name: OX20 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 25 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting a large area, and it's likely several streets in your area are affected by the same power cut.

Our engineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored as soon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aiming to restore your power by 04:00 26/11/2024. If this changes, we will update this message.

We have had reports of a overhead power line coming down. When this happens, the power will automatically turn off to keep everyone safe. Our engineers know exactly where the problem is and are working hard to make the situation safe, repair the wire and get your power back on. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'PW1506'
